unnormalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews - Real Estate & Property**
normalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews - Real Estate and Property**

unnormalised: Hey everyone, thinking of buying a flat in Pune and super stressed about choosing the right builder. Has anyone had experience with Rohan Builders or the Godrej Properties projects near Hinjewadi? Their brochures look amazing, but I'd love some real-world insights.
normalised: Hey everyone, thinking of buying a flat in Pune and super stressed about choosing the right builder. Has anyone had experience with Rohan Builders or the Godrej Properties projects near Hinjewadi? Their brochures look amazing, but I would love some real-world insights.

unnormalised: Specifically, I'm looking for feedback on quality of construction, adherence to promised timelines (did they really deliver by 25/12/2024 as promised?), and after-sales service. I've heard horror stories of builders disappearing after possession, leaving residents stranded with pending issues.
normalised: Specifically, I am looking for feedback on quality of construction, adherence to promised timelines (did they really deliver by twenty fifth december two thousand and twenty four as promised?), and after-sales service. I have heard horror stories of builders disappearing after possession, leaving residents stranded with pending issues.

unnormalised: Also, what's the deal with super area vs. carpet area these days? I got a quote from a local builder, Shinde Constructions, for a 2BHK, and the difference between the two was HUGE. Felt like I was being cheated of my hard-earned Rs. 50 Lakhs!
normalised: Also, what is the deal with super area versus carpet area these days? I got a quote from a local builder, Shinde Constructions, for a two B H K, and the difference between the two was huge. Felt like I was being cheated of my hard-earned rupee fifty lakhs!

unnormalised: Anyone else faced similar issues? Also, is it worth hiring a property lawyer to review the agreement papers before signing on the dotted line? I'm scheduled to meet with Axis Bank at 11:00 hrs on 10/07/2023 for a loan approval, so need to finalize things quickly.
normalised: Anyone else faced similar issues? Also, is it worth hiring a property lawyer to review the agreement papers before signing on the dotted line? I am scheduled to meet with Axis Bank at eleven hundred hours on tenth july two thousand and twenty three for a loan approval, so need to finalize things quickly.

unnormalised: Would love to hear your experiences and tips! Maybe someone from IIT Bombay can chime in with insights on structural integrity? After all, we want our homes to last longer than just the next monsoon! Jai Hind!
normalised: Would love to hear your experiences and tips! Maybe someone from I I T Bombay can chime in with insights on structural integrity? After all, we want our homes to last longer than just the next monsoon! Jai Hind!
